intro: Phagnalon androssovii, commonly known as the Androsowian phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in rocky and dry environments. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is known for its adaptability to harsh conditions and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
